div.head: The corpus
div.p:
The project ANTONOMAZ, in collaboration with the Bibliothèque Mazarine, aims to encode the Mazarinades's corpus in order to integrate it to a database usable by different audiences (researchers, students...) and to allow it to be studied. The Mazarinades are a serie of textual sources of different genres (pamphlets, poems, letters, etc.) published during the Fronde (1648 - 1653) mostly against the Cardinal Jules Mazarin. The project uses the works of Célestin Moreau (Bibliographie des Mazarinades) and of Hubert Carrier (Presses de la Fronde). We encoded fac-similes from these digital libraries:
Gallica (Bibliothèque Nationale de France)
Mazarinum (Bibliothèque Mazarine)
Google Books

div.head: Identifying the document
div.p:
One of our priorities is to clearly identify the text once encoded. We chose to give to each document an unique identifier consisting of the name of the digital library where the document was founded and its digital permanent identifier. So, for a gallica's one, it will beGALL_bpt6k95984c. The filename will match with the xml:id. This is going to be modified in the future. Here is the list for the different possibilities in naming documents:
mazarinum: MAZ_1234
gallica: GALL_1234
Google Books: GBOOKS_1234
In addition, each document will get a type inside the TEI declaration which corresponds to the corpus it belongs. For example, if the text is a burlesque mazarinade, write "Mazarinade_burlesque".

div.head: Headers encoding
div.p: The header contains: a fileDesc, an encodingDesc and a profileDesc.

div.head: The fileDesc
div.p:
This part of the header contains four parts :
the titleStmt
the respStmt
the publicationStmt
the sourceDesc

div.head: The titleStmt
div.p: This part is essential for the presentation of the encoded document. It has to contain two titles : a main title (title of the work) and a sub title (ANTONOMAZ édition).

titleStmt.title: Visions astrologiques de Michel Nostradamus sur toutes les affaires de ce temps, et la confusion de Mazarin. En vers burlesques
ANTONOMAZ édition

div.head: The respStmt
div.p: This part contains the list of persons having worked on the document's encoding. It is necessary to indicate a persName with a role attribute and an affiliation and the ORCID (if there is one) for each person.

div.head: The publicationStmt
div.p: This part contains always the publisher, a ref and the availibility which contains the licence. In our project, this part is always the same.

div.head: The sourceDesc
div.p: This part contains two main elements: monogr and imprint. The first one contains the elements title and author. The second one contains the elements pubPlace,publisher, date and note
Specifications about the element author, if the author is not certain, add:

list.item: @source: "Name of the attributor (a person, an institution...)"

div.p: About the element date: if someone dated the document -the date was not inscribed on the original document - give the identity of the attributor like this: @source:"Name of the attributor"

About the element note: there is three @type:
"nombre_pages": number or pages of the document as indicated in Bibliographie des Mazarinades
"identifier_Moreau": each document has an unique Moreau number. If we say "3600", it means it's the 3600th document in the Bibliographie.
"BM_identifier" : identifier from mazarinum (the Bibliothèque Mazarine's digital library)

monogr.title: Visions astrologiques de Michel Nostradamus sur toutes les affaires de ce temps, et la confusion de Mazarin. En vers burlesques
monogr.author: Nostradamus

div.head: The msDesc
div.p:
Even if the Mazarinades are, for the most part, printed documents, the msDesc was useful to us. To ensure a good encoding, severals elements are recommanded :
msIdentifier which contains information used to properly identify the manuscript
Paris Bibliothèque Nationale de France Réserve des livres rares YE-4819
msContent which contains information about the intellectual content of the manuscript
physDescwhich contains information about the physical description of the document such as the objectDesc or the bindingDesc.
En vers, les "visions" sont en quatrains d'alexandrins, "La confusion de Mazarin", en dizains d'octosyllabes. Texte paru en janvier 1649 d’après Hubert Carrier (Bibliothèque Mazarine, Ms 4682-2, f. 406v).
in-4
history which contains information about the history of the manuscript. We used it to report the presence or absence of a stamp with a boolean (true or false).
additionalwhich contains more information about the document, such as surrogates or bibliographical information (bibl). It was used to point towards digital editions from gallica and mazarinum.
False

div.head: The encodingDesc
div.p:
This part contains some general informations about the project and the documents' encoding. It uses the following elements:
projectDesc
editorialDecl

projectDesc.p: Cette édition a été réalisée dans le cadre du projet ANTONOMAZ. Son objectif principal est de fournir un texte destiné à l'exploration avec des outils électroniques. De ce fait, ce n'est ni une édition philologique, ni une édition pédagogique ou de redécouverte d'un auteur oublié.
Les textes encodés dans le cadre du projet ANTONOMAZ sont issus de numérisations de bibliothèques numériques publiques et de Google livres.
L'édition présentée ici est issue d'un processus d'OCRisation réalisé avec Kraken.

correction.p: Les erreurs typographiques ont été signalées à l'aide des éléments sic et corr

normalization.p: La transcription est la plus diplomatique possible.
Les graphie et orthographe d'origine ont été respectées, y compris lettres non dissimilées : ij/uv,'s' longs, et abréviations.

hyphenation.p: Les vers ont été représentés à l'aide des éléments l et lb. Les strophes ont été représentées à l'aide de l'élément lg.
Les textes en prose ont été redécoupés à l'aide de l'élément lb. Les paragraphes ont été signalés à l'aide de l'élément p.
La division des mots en fin de ligne respecte le fac-similé original. Elle est signalée par l'attribut "break" et "¬".

punctuation.p: La ponctuation d'origine a été respectée, y compris quand elle paraissait fautive, alors signalée à l'aide des éléments sic et corr

div.head: The profileDesc
div.p: This part describes non bibliographical informations.

div.head: Text encoding
div.p: First, at all levels our edition must contain a text element with the following namespace : @xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0". It checks the validation of the TEI schema.

Then, we use the element body with:
head: contains the elements pb for page beginning with a link pointing towards the right page on the fac-simile, title for the title on the front page, ref which contains a link to the printer mark and note for edition's informations.
pb for page beginning.
fw : has three types : "pageNum" for page numbers, "catch" for catches", "sig" for signatures.
p for prose parts.
l for versified parts
lg for stanzas
lb for line beginning. It can be employed both for poetry and text inside a p. It can get two attributes : rend and break used for cut words.
hi is used for any graphic distinction
sic reports an error in the original text.
corr indicates a correction made by the editor of the encoded text.
foreign is used to indicate a word or a word group in a language different from the original one. It gets one attribute xml:lang
note to encode any note in the original text. Its location on the page should be indicated with a place.
